ul_480732: sed -n '1{/^#include/p};q'   file

sed -n '/^#include/p;q'   file

for file in *
do
    [ "$(sed -n '/^#include/p;q' "$file")" ] && printf '%s\n' "$file"
done

sed -n '1{/^#include/!q};p'  file

sed -ne '1{/^#include/!q;}' -e p  file

sed -n '1{
           /^#include/!q
         }
         p
       '  file

ul_528009: grep -Po '^\s*\K/.*' file | 
    sed 's/\s*\\//'  | 
        while IFS= read -r path; do 
            [[ -e "$path" ]] && 
                printf 'FOUND: "%s"\n' "$path" || 
                printf "ERROR: '%s' doesn't exist\n" "$path"; 
        done
